revised_title: Experimental and Theoretical Analysis of Oil Film in Lubricated Point Contact
tldr: The authors developed a technique using Newton's rings to map the oil film of lubricated point contacts and derived a theoretical solution for elastohydrodynamic lubrication in point contact. They found that the oil film thickness was accurately predicted by the theory, providing strong evidence for a viscous surface layer about 1000 Å thick, which correlates with the "lubricating power" of the tested oils. This research contributes to understanding the lubrication of heavily loaded point contacts in engineering applications.
